item.description:
We've all heard of the Passion of the Christ. Our topic, The Passion of the Atheist, came up regarding a blog by atheist Greta Christina, about atheists and anger.

http://gretachristina...

Atheists will enjoy reading her blog (caution: it does contain strong language), which offers a litany of reasons why atheists are atheists, and why Greta Christina, in particular, is angry.

As a point of discussion for this meeting, we will broach whether anger is useful/necessary as a tool for social change/acceptance, as it has been used in other social movements. Are you a passionate or passive atheist? We will explore how we define our roles as participants (or as non-participants) in atheism as a social-change movement.

We will also continue our discussion about outreach efforts, including a "Coming out of the Closet" meeting idea.

Lending Library: many members have books relevant to atheism to share, and at the last Wednesday night meeting the group began collaborating on a lending library of sorts. Bring a list of books you have to share (or email it to the group in advance) and perhaps you could bring several select books to lend.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for the large group, some might be wearing atheistic shirts
item.name: Sunday Morning Topical Meeting--The Passion of the Atheist
